worklogs.comment:
wesm commented on pull request #6368: ARROW-1636: [C++][Integration] Implement integration test parsing in C++ for null type, add integration test data generation
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6368
 
 
   This enables integration testing of null type for C++ and Java. I was a bit surprised that the cross-compatibility tests passed so I would appreciate a sanity check from a Java developer to see if there are integration tests covering the integration-JSON-format parsing and null type IPC round trip. If there are not, let's ensure there are relevant JIRA issues so it can be tested and kept working

wesm commented on issue #6368: ARROW-1636: [C++][Integration] Implement integration test parsing in C++ for null type, add integration test data generation
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6368#issuecomment-587567398
 
 
   @lidavidm @liyafan82 @tianchen92 @emkornfield the "generated_null" case fails in the Flight integration tests but passes in the IPC test (i.e. when you omit `--run-flight`). The failure is
   
   ```
   With output:
   --------------
   SLF4J: Failed to load class "org.slf4j.impl.StaticLoggerBinder".
   SLF4J: Defaulting to no-operation (NOP) logger implementation
   SLF4J: See http://www.slf4j.org/codes.html#StaticLoggerBinder for further details.
   WARNING: An illegal reflective access operation has occurred
   WARNING: Illegal reflective access by io.netty.util.internal.ReflectionUtil (file:/home/wesm/code/arrow/java/flight/flight-core/target/flight-core-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT-jar-with-dependencies.jar) to constructor java.nio.DirectByteBuffer(long,int)
   WARNING: Please consider reporting this to the maintainers of io.netty.util.internal.ReflectionUtil
   WARNING: Use --illegal-access=warn to enable warnings of further illegal reflective access operations
   WARNING: All illegal access operations will be denied in a future release
   Verifying location grpc+tcp://localhost:35839
   Exception in thread "main" java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Different row count:
   0 != 10
   	at org.apache.arrow.flight.example.integration.IntegrationTestClient.testStream(IntegrationTestClient.java:175)
   	at org.apache.arrow.flight.example.integration.IntegrationTestClient.run(IntegrationTestClient.java:95)
   	at org.apache.arrow.flight.example.integration.IntegrationTestClient.main(IntegrationTestClient.java:68)
   Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Different row count:
   0 != 10
   	at org.apache.arrow.vector.util.Validator.compareVectorSchemaRoot(Validator.java:98)
   	at org.apache.arrow.flight.example.integration.IntegrationTestClient.testStream(IntegrationTestClient.java:173)
   	... 2 more
   ```
   
   This implies there is a missing assertion on the IPC side of the test. Can someone help?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

lidavidm commented on issue #6368: ARROW-1636: [C++][Integration] Implement integration test parsing in C++ for null type, add integration test data generation
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6368#issuecomment-587593218
 
 
   https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/java/tools/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/tools/Integration.java#L208
   
   If I'm not mistaken, this means that we only compare the data fully if there's actual data in both JSON and in the Arrow file?
   
   Though the Flight test is also potentially wrong: 
   
   https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/java/flight/flight-core/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/flight/example/integration/IntegrationTestClient.java#L166-L173
   
   It only compares the last batch sent over the wire.

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

fields.description: This was not implemented on the C++ side, and came up in ARROW-1584. Realistically arrays may be of null type, and we should be able to message these correctly

comments.body: [~bryanc] [~siddteotia] or [~icexelloss] might one of you be able to look at the Java side of this?

Assuming [~icexelloss] and [~bryanc] don't mind, I can take it. Since I haven't added any integration tests yet, I think this is probably a good starting point to get going on those aspects of Arrow code.
[~siddteotia] go ahead! Feel free to let me know if you got an issues running the integration tests.
If we can get to this for 0.9.0, that's great too
[~pravindra] is Null type used at all in Gandiva yet? Having integration tests for null type may not be too much work

Gandiva doesn't support null types. It's a bit convoluted but the list of supported types in gandiva are :

[https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/src/gandiva/llvm_types.cc#L24]

curious, what's the use case for a null type ?
We observe (un-schema'd) data that is all nulls, so in such cases we refuse to guess about the type. It might be a good idea for Gandiva to support null at some point (which can cast to anything)
[~emkornfield@gmail.com] [~pravindra] wanted to follow up about this to see if we can fill the hole in integration testing. Does Java have a NullVector type?
I don't think it does.  I'll try to do this after I handle unions unless [~pravindra] wants to take it on?
[~emkornfield@gmail.com] [~liyafan] [~tianchen92] popping this on your radar again
See also ARROW-1638 for the Java impl of this
ok, we'll take a close watch at this issue:).
I can look at the integration tests for this for 1.0
This seems to be the same as ARROW-590: can we close one, and if so, any preference for which to keep?
I don't think so.  Null is distinct type from Union?  Maybe related to ARROW-1277 though?
Right, sorry, I was cleaning up the 1.0 backlog yesterday and these tickets started bleeding together in my mind.

I can still take the time to implement the integration tests (in "archery/integration") when we're ready to make a push for 1.0, someone else can look sooner if they want to learn about this part of the project
